definition: to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat

sentences.english: Whenever we do this, then the whole nation is degraded.
sentences.chinese: 这样的行为让我们整个民族为之蒙羞。

sentences.english: Stealing reflects dishonour on your family.
sentences.chinese: 偷窃行为会使家人蒙羞。

sentences.english: Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Zion.
sentences.chinese: 愿恨恶锡安的，都蒙羞退后。

sentences.english: They shall be ashamed, and also confounded, all of them: they shall go to confusion together that are makers of idols.
sentences.chinese: 凡制造偶像的，都必抱愧蒙羞，都要一同归于惭愧。

sentences.english: This is the height of irresponsibility, and all involved should be ashamed of themselves.
sentences.chinese: 这是非常不负责任的行为，这让所有牵涉其中者蒙羞。

sentences.english: This would have been a centre-left landslide, with Cameron humiliated.
sentences.chinese: 其结果会是中间偏左的政党大胜，卡梅伦蒙羞。

sentences.english: Our regiment was disgraced by your conduct.
sentences.chinese: 我团因为你的行为而蒙羞。

sentences.english: Lest my bewailed guilt should do thee shame.
sentences.chinese: 以免你因我的悲罪蒙羞受气。

sentences.english: May my heart be blameless toward your decrees, that I may not be put to shame. ( k Kaph )
sentences.chinese: 愿我的心在你的律例上完全，使我不致蒙羞。

sentences.english: Have crybaby clients and lawyers led Lady Justice astray?
sentences.chinese: 那些惹事的顾客和律师让正义女神蒙羞？

sentences.english: Pass on in nakedness and shame, you who live in Shaphir.
sentences.chinese: 沙斐的居民哪，你们要赤身蒙羞过去。

sentences.english: But the awful truth at Olympus is not just embarrassing.
sentences.chinese: 但奥林巴斯的可怕真相还不只是让人蒙羞。

sentences.english: Let them be dismayed and shamed forever; let them perish in disgrace.
sentences.chinese: 使他们永远受辱恐慌，叫他们个个蒙羞丧亡。

sentences.english: And that stigma is all across United States when we see corporate logos.
sentences.chinese: 当我们看到共同的标识时，在全美都使它蒙羞。

sentences.english: LORD, righteousness belongeth unto thee, but unto us confusion of faces, as at this day;
sentences.chinese: 主阿，你是公义的，我们是脸上蒙羞的。

definition: lit. for one's face to reach rock bottom/to be thoroughly discredited (idiom)
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
to be ashamed to face (sb)/to feel bad about having failed (sb)
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
to completely lose (one's dignity, vitality etc)
a matter for ridicule/an object of ridicule/laughingstock
to spit on and curse/to revile
